chatter.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to talk quickly in a friendly way without stopping, especially about things that are not serious or important
chatter.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: She chattered away happily until she noticed I wasn’t listening.
She chattered excitedly like a child.
We were chattering about the events of last night.
chatter.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if birds or monkeys chatter, they make short high sounds
chatter.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if your teeth are chattering, you are so cold or frightened that your teeth are knocking together
chatter.translation[1].definitions[0].de: informal talk, especially about things that are not serious or important
chatter.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Jane’s constant chatter was annoying him.
She was full of chatter about her new friends.
the excited chatter of the audience
chatter.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a series of short high sounds made by some birds or monkeys
chatter.translation[1].definitions[2].de: a hard quick repeated sound made by your teeth knocking together or by machines
